meanings.sent1: The overfine lace on the dress tore easily.
meanings.sent2: The artist's overfine brushstrokes added a unique texture to the painting.
meanings.sent3: She spent hours creating an overfine design on her nails, only to accidentally smudge it.
meanings.sent4: The overfine details of the miniature model made it look like a real house.
meanings.sent5: The overfine embroidery on the pillow made it a luxurious addition to the room.

meanings.definition: to make too fine or delicate
meanings.sent1: Please do not overfine the fabric, or it may become too fragile.
meanings.sent2: The chef accidentally overfined the sauce, making it too thin to coat the pasta properly.
meanings.sent3: He overfined the sandcastle so much that it collapsed under its own weight.
meanings.sent4: The jeweler overfined the gold, creating a piece that was too delicate to wear daily.
meanings.sent5: The artist overfined the clay sculpture, causing it to break during firing.

meanings.sent1: It is possible to overfine a skill, losing the natural flair in the process.
meanings.sent2: The writer tended to overfine his sentences, making them convoluted and hard to read.
meanings.sent3: She overfined the recipe by adding too many unnecessary ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The company overfined their product, pricing it out of reach for most customers.
meanings.sent5: The musician overfined the melody, losing the raw emotion that made it special.
